data.title: Poet Robert Black Poems
data.meta_description: Robert Black poems, quotations and biography on Robert Black poet page. Robert Black poetry page; read all poems by Robert Black written.
data.text:
The Best Poem Of Robert Black

It Was Dirty When The Nurses Danced

It was dirty when Tedros told people to travel

It was dirty when sick people were put next to the old and the vulnerable

It was dirty when the media lied

It was dirty when the nurses danced

It was dirty when death certificates were faked

It was dirty when Hancock said, 'Test, test, test! '

It was dirty when they locked down the well

It was dirty when they let people die alone

It was dirty when they closed the borders

It was dirty when they crashed the economies

It was dirty when Gates said everyone must be vaccinated

It was dirty when Gates said the next one will get attention this time

It was dirty when Fauci and The Lancet said hydroxychloroquine was no good

It was dirty when they used ineffective tests with false positives

It was dirty when they made the children wear masks

It was dirty when they put people in isolation

It was dirty when they enacted laws destroying human rights

It was dirty when the politicized police arrested people for not wearing a mask

It was dirty when the politicized police beat innocent protesters in the street

And no matter how much they sanitize

The complicit will never be clean
